Class Team<T extends Participant>

java.lang.Object
com.education.ztu.game.Team<T>
Type Parameters:
T - the type of participants in this team, must extend Participant
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Team<T extends Participant> extends Object implements Serializable
Represents a team of participants in the game system.

This generic class provides a type-safe container for participants using Java Generics. A team can hold multiple participants of the same type (e.g., all Students, all Employees), ensuring compile-time type safety. Teams can compete against other teams of the same type.

Generic Type Safety:

The Team class is generic with type parameter <T extends Participant>. This ensures:

  • A Team<Schoolar> can only contain Schoolar participants
  • A Team<Student> can only contain Student participants
  • A Team<Employee> can only contain Employee participants
  • These constraints are enforced at compile time, not runtime

Key Features:

  • Serializable: Teams can be serialized and persisted
  • Transient Fields: Rating and wins are not serialized
  • Deep Cloning: Create independent copies of teams
  • Game Simulation: Teams can play against each other

Transient Fields:

The rating and wins fields are marked as transient and will not be serialized. This means these game statistics are reset when a team is deserialized. This is intentional for separating persistent data (participants) from runtime data (statistics).

Usage Example:

// Create participants
Student student1 = new Student("John", 20);
Student student2 = new Student("Jane", 21);

// Create a team
Team<Student> team = new Team<>("Eagles");

// Add participants to the team
team.addNewParticipant(student1);
team.addNewParticipant(student2);

// Create another team
Team<Student> otherTeam = new Team<>("Hawks");
otherTeam.addNewParticipant(new Student("Mike", 22));

// Teams play against each other
team.playWith(otherTeam);

// Clone a team
Team<Student> teamClone = Team.deepClone(team);

Constructor Details:

  • Team(String): Creates a new team with a name
  • Team(Team): Creates a deep copy of another team
Since:
2024

  • Constructor Details

    • Team

      public Team(String name)
      Constructs a new Team with the specified name.

      This constructor initializes the team with:

      • The provided team name
      • An empty list of participants
      • An initial rating of 1000
      • An initial wins count of 0

      Parameters:
      name - the name of the team (e.g., "Dragons", "Vpered")
      See Also:
      • getName()

    • Team

      public Team(Team<T> other)
      Constructs a new Team as a deep copy of another team.

      This copy constructor creates a completely independent team with:

      • The same name as the original
      • Deep copies of all participants (clones)
      • The same rating as the original
      • The same wins count as the original
      The original team and the copy are completely independent. Modifying one does not affect the other.

      Parameters:
      other - the team to copy (must not be null)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if other is null
      See Also:
      • deepClone(Team)

  • Method Details

    • deepClone

      public static <T extends Participant> Team<T> deepClone(Team<T> original)
      Creates a deep copy of a team using the copy constructor.

      This static factory method provides an alternative way to clone a team. It is equivalent to calling new Team<>(original) but is more explicit about the intent to create a deep clone.

      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of participants in the team
      Parameters:
      original - the team to clone (must not be null)
      Returns:
      a new Team with the same data but independent from the original
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if original is null
      See Also:
      • Team(Team)

    • addNewParticipant

      public void addNewParticipant(T participant)
      Adds a new participant to the team.

      This method adds the specified participant to the team's participant list and logs the action. The participant is added to the end of the list.

      Parameters:
      participant - the participant to add (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if participant is null
      See Also:
      • getParticipants()

    • playWith

      public void playWith(Team<T> team)
      Simulates a game between this team and another team of the same type.

      This method:

      • Randomly selects a winner between the two teams
      • Increments the wins counter for the winning team
      • Logs the game result and winner information
      • Prints the result to the console
      The outcome is determined purely by chance using Random.

      Parameters:
      team - the opposing team to play against (must not be null)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if team is null
      See Also:
      • getName()
      • wins

      public String getName()
      Returns the name of the team.
      Returns:
      the team's name as a String
      See Also:

    • getParticipants

      public List<T> getParticipants()
      Returns the list of all participants in the team.

      The returned list is the actual list used internally, not a copy. Modifications to the returned list will affect the team.

      Returns:
      a List of participants of type T
      See Also:
      • setParticipants(List)
      • addNewParticipant(Participant)

    • setName

      public void setName(String name)
      Sets the name of the team.

      This method updates the team's name and logs the change.

      Parameters:
      name - the new name for the team
      See Also:
      • getName()

    • setParticipants

      public void setParticipants(List<T> participants)
      Sets the list of participants for the team.

      This method replaces the entire participants list with a new one. If the provided list is null, it creates an empty list instead.

      Parameters:
      participants - the new list of participants (can be null, which becomes empty list)
      See Also:
      • getParticipants()

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the team.

      The string includes the team's name and the list of all participants. Format: Team{name='...', participants=[...]}

      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation containing team name and participants

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Indicates whether some other object is "equal to" this one.

      Two teams are considered equal if and only if:

      • They are the same object in memory, OR
      • They are both Team instances with identical name AND identical participants list
      Note: The rating and wins fields are NOT considered in equality comparison.

      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - the reference object with which to compare
      Returns:
      true if this object is equal to the argument; false otherwise
      See Also:
      • hashCode()

    • hashCode

      public int hashCode()
      Returns a hash code value for the team.

      The hash code is calculated based on the name and participants fields. Teams with equal name and identical participants will have the same hash code.

      Overrides:
      hashCode in class Object
      Returns:
      a hash code value for this team
      See Also:
      • equals(Object)
      • Objects.hash(Object...)
